findings.title: S3 Bucket Publicly Accessible
findings.description: S3 bucket 'insureco-customer-documents' has public read access enabled via bucket ACL. This bucket contains customer policy documents and personal information.
findings.remediation: Remove public access by updating bucket ACL and enabling Block Public Access settings

findings.title: Overly Permissive IAM Role
findings.description: IAM role 'insureco-web-app-role' has wildcard permissions (s3:*) allowing unrestricted S3 access. This violates principle of least privilege.
findings.remediation: Restrict IAM policy to specific S3 actions (GetObject, PutObject) and specific bucket ARNs

findings.title: RDS Instance Not Encrypted
findings.description: RDS PostgreSQL instance 'insureco-prod-db' does not have encryption at rest enabled. Database contains customer PII and payment information.
findings.remediation: Enable encryption at rest using AWS KMS. Note: Requires creating encrypted snapshot and restoring to new instance.

findings.title: Security Group Allows Unrestricted SSH Access
findings.description: Security group allows SSH access (port 22) from 0.0.0.0/0. This increases attack surface for brute force attacks.
findings.remediation: Restrict SSH access to specific IP ranges or use AWS Systems Manager Session Manager

findings.title: CloudTrail Log File Validation Not Enabled
findings.description: CloudTrail trail 'insureco-cloudtrail' does not have log file validation enabled, preventing detection of log tampering.
findings.remediation: Enable log file validation in CloudTrail trail configuration
